Lack of clear communication and coordination between different government agencies responsible for implementing the policy, resulting in conflicting messages and inefficiencies.
Inadequate resources and funding to support the policy, leading to delays and insufficient implementation.
Resistance from interest groups and stakeholders who stand to be affected by the policy, leading to political backlash and obstruction.
Unforeseen consequences of the policy, such as unintended side effects or unanticipated impacts on other areas of government policy.
Technical challenges and limitations in implementing the policy, such as compatibility issues with existing systems or infrastructure.
